sentence.text: From here descend north-east along a thinner path into Dovedale which leads to Hartsop Hall Farm ( 2 miles ) .
` Do n't so much as breathe on her , " Leo warned coldly as he descended the stairs behind them .
` His name is Matthew Blake , " Mandy informed Charity as they descended the steps from their cabin on to the paved pathway that led to the lodge .
Araminta , on the point of descending the stairs in a cream pique dress , turned round and went back to her room .
The Nez Perce then descended the eastern Bitterroots into Montana on 25th July to find their path blocked by a crude stockade , subsequently dubbed ` Fort Fizzle " .
At last she started to descend the rungs into the hole .
We now descend a winding road into the village .
The gatherers descend the sheer cliff-face on coconut-fibre ropes to an overhang some thirty feet above the water where a rickety bamboo platform has been built .
From the top of Mynydd Tal-y-mignedd descend south on the grass until the path starts to get steep ( 534-509 ) .
From the summit descend steeply north-west to Bwlch Eryl Farchog .
Melissa descended the stairs to the front door with Sybil following .
At seven-thirty Paige descended the grand sweeping staircase to the hall .
Leading the animal by its reins , she descended the steep path towards the place of tents .
Venables broke both legs in a 90m fall while descending the mountain after the first ascent .
I have never descended a pothole , and have ventured with a flashlight only in the caves promised by caving journals to be without danger .
Joe descended the stairs , a grin on his face .
I crept to it , saw that she was sleeping deeply , put on my dressing-gown and slippers , and descended the staircase .
The steep east bank may be descended , with care , for a more comprehensive view .
As we descended it became increasingly hot , and in the space of two hours we had dropped from rolling grassy hills to a sandy , semi-desert plain .
At last Lachlan descended the spiral and stopped on the final step .
In very hot weather , the workers descend tunnels that go deep into the ground to the water table .
From Dale Head Tarn it is possible to cut across the top of High Scawdel to Honister Pass and then descend by road to Buttermere , partly across open fell and partly on footpath ( 1 mile ) .
Another manager , Malcolm Dowty , said : ` With breathing apparatus on his back , he would not be able to descend through a 2ft manhole . "
You descend further through the trees and turn left along the forest road to meet a tarmac road .
Immediately the two youngsters had been forced to descend back down into the tunnel .
Once in our picturesque ski village , our friends were anxious to hire the gear and get straightaway into the serious business of descending headfirst down something snow-capped .
We descended immediately down the zig-zags of the north west face .

From here you should descend along a northerly spur that will include two further tops , Stob Coire Easain and Beinn na Soacaich , and head for a dam , which you will find where the Allt Coire an Eoin meets the trees .

At the top of the dry valley I scramble down to the green path , following the old hedge of thorns and elders , pointing the way , beckoning me onwards as I descend the gently curving path down the rolling hillside .
Having finished , she descends a little way down the twig and then lays another batch .
She had to descend very gingerly , both for fear of missing her footing and of startling the cat into digging its claws into her or jumping from her shoulders suddenly .
